title: How the metaverse (and quantum physics) could prove our universe is a fake
content:
Our universe is a ridiculous place. It’s where all the silliest things we’re aware of happen. And chief among the silliness is the wacky idea of time. Don’t get me wrong, the metaverse is a strong second. Especially Facebook’s Meta’s agonizingly dysfunctional approach to building it. But time’s even stranger than changing the name of the world’s most widely-known technology company to something that literally means “self-referential.” Time is the opposite of self-referential. If it exists in a tangible, physical form, then we might be living in a simulated universe — our own bespoke layer in the metaverse. This might…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: Do we live in a simulation? No. Yes. Maybe? We may have to wait until Zuckerberg finishes building the metaverse.
